body.p:
I received your very kind letter of 10 Dec
& am quite ashamed of not having acknowledged it before, but
the enclosed reflections must impart plead my excuse if they meet
your approbation & at the time I received it I was also engaged in
writing to a clergyman who after a lapse of five years had the Grace
to answer a letter which I write to him on subjects connected with
our Holy religion. however I delivered your enclosed letter to our
friend Mr I Lindo & called on Mrs Joel who said she had already
forwarded to you the statement you required. I also called on the
Publisher of the Jewish Chronicle who in as much surprised that
there should have been any irregularity in the delivery of the numbers
which he say were regularly posted every week he gave me the
enclosed order for a set of the Jewish Miscellany which he request
you to send at your earliest convenience & he will pay the cost to Mrs
Joel or elsewhere as you may direct I have received the prospectus
of the works you propose engaging in & should feel very happy if
I could contribute to your success, but I have already told you
what very little influence I possess in the nation & what a reserved
life I lead I fear any application on my part for support to
your exertion it would be ineffectual & be considered as a rem[?]
instance of my assurance put me down as a subscriber
to the Jewish advocate–

I am glad you received the apocryphal New Testament I presume
Dr Raphael is correct in stating that the Publisher [?] was prosecuted
but I do not think it could have been for this publication you will see
that several of the books have been translated & published in the works
of learned men here. but I remember seeing in his shop windows in
fleet street an atrocious caricature of the almighty in which he was
depicted with all the figurative descriptions used in the Bible &
at the foot "Christians Here is your God as by Law established"

I believe few persons had the audacity to enter the shop & purchase it
I had not. I see the result of your interview with Mr Knit his
reply that the synod had resolved to reply only to a Jewish assembly
of [?] & not to an individual is very significant. however the ques
tion how my letter came to the hands of the publisher of the asmonean
will soon be solved for I see by the number for the week ending 20
decr (which the publisher politely sent me) that my letter was
sent to him by a Gentleman connected with the Synod accompanied
by an answer which on account of the [?] of the stile he did not
publish & he proposed doing up shortly with a running commentary

If the answer is signed by the writer & requires any other answer
than the commentary I shall perhaps take notice of it, but not if it
is anonymous perhaps you will say that my writings which you have
though worthy of a place in your interesting periodical has also been
anonymous by they have not been written to or at anybody but your
self & to any inquirers you could always supply the name
I read with much pleasure your review of Dr Raphel's lectures
